main event: A pilot and crew observed a metallic, circular object over the city of Gander, Newfoundland that was traveling at a high rate of speed, around 1,000 miles per hour, and oscillating slightly.
interesting points: The object was first detected on radar at approximately 30,000 feet over the city of Gander.
When the pilot attempted to close in on the object, it appeared to pull away at a very high rate of speed, causing the pilot to discontinue the pursuit.
The object was observed by a total of four witnesses, including the pilot and crew, who all described it as metallic in appearance, circular in shape, and traveling at a high rate of speed.
The Air Force considered this to be a genuine UFO sighting, and all attempts to identify or classify the object have proved negative.
The sighting cannot be reasonably explained by any conventional explanation or aerial vehicle known to be in operation at that time.
